intro: Mesembryanthemum rostratum, commonly known as the narrowleaf ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Mesembryanthemum rostratum is also known for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
